high.label: High Urgency
high.description: You are experiencing symptoms that could indicate a serious condition requiring immediate medical attention.
high.advice: Please seek immediate medical care. Go to the nearest emergency room or call emergency services now.

moderate.label: Moderate Urgency
moderate.description: Some of your symptoms suggest a condition that needs prompt medical evaluation.
moderate.advice: Please contact a healthcare professional within 24 hours for an evaluation.

low.label: Low Urgency
low.description: Your symptoms are generally mild and do not appear to require immediate medical attention.
low.advice: You may consider contacting a healthcare professional if your symptoms worsen or persist.

high.name: Heart Attack
high.description: A serious condition where blood flow to the heart is blocked, often causing chest pain, shortness of breath, and weakness.

high.name: Pulmonary Embolism
high.description: A blood clot that travels to the lungs, causing chest pain and difficulty breathing.

moderate.name: Angina
moderate.description: Chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart muscle.

moderate.name: Pneumonia
moderate.description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, potentially causing chest pain and shortness of breath.

low.name: Muscle Strain
low.description: A minor injury to chest muscles that can cause pain, especially with movement.

low.name: Anxiety
low.description: Can cause physical symptoms like chest tightness, shortness of breath, and weakness.
